programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of FBI agent Sue Thomas in Washington DC. She's one hard-headed, soft-hearted woman whose talent for reading lips helps crack crimes and bag the bad guys in places listening devices can't penetrate. With her hearing-ear dog, Levi, Sue's a glutton for jeopardy - and there's (almost) nothing she won't do to bring notorious criminals to justice. This remarkable, edge-of-your-seat drama is an inspiring tribute to the ability of the human spirit to overcome adversity and achieve great things. Inspired by a true story.(n)

programme.title: When Calls the Heart
programme.desc: When Calls the Heart follows the adventures of Elizabeth Thatcher, a young teacher accustomed to her high-society life. She receives her first classroom assignment in Hope Valley, a small town in Western Canada. There, life is simple - but often fraught with challenges. Elizabeth charms most everyone in Hope Valley, especially young mountie Jack Thornton. Elizabeth must learn the ways of the Canadian frontier if she wishes to thrive in the rural west on her own but she soon learns that friendship and community are the source of love and life.(n)

programme.title: Bringing Up Bates
programme.desc: It's time for the annual family lake trip! Some of the kids go boating, some go skiing, some stay dry and others try to get everyone wet! At the end of the day, the family gathers for a great family picnic and a game of capture the flag!(n)

programme.title: Convocation
programme.desc: Convocation at Liberty University is North America's largest weekly gathering of Christian students, and each year it plays host to more than 80 guest speakers of national significance from every sphere of society. The services, held within the Vines Centre at the University during each semester, connect students with their Creator through passionate worship and powerful messages firmly rooted in Biblical truth.(n)

programme.title: Better Together
programme.sub-title: E07 Would you Still Be Grateful If...?
programme.desc: A program by women for women...we discuss faith, family, friends, and so much more - no topic is off limits. Find out what happens when real friends get together for real conversations!(n)

programme.title: Joyce Meyer Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.sub-title: E59 How to Have Successful Relationships
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the world's leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.(n)

programme.title: Joel Osteen
programme.desc: Direct from Houston, Texas, USA, join Joel and Victoria Osteen and the team from Lakewood Church for this program of powerful music and empowering preaching. Experience from the weekend church service of Lakewood Church, the largest and fastest growing church in America that is inspiring millions of people around the world!(n)

programme.title: Restoring The Shack
programme.desc: Join author Paul Young on an adventure into the world of the best-selling phenomenon, \.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Join us for a musical celebration of life and faith as Songs of Praise travels throughout Britain and the world presenting soul stirring hymns and touching stories of inspiration.(n)

programme.title: Steve McQueen: American Icon
programme.desc: Steve McQueen truly is an American Icon. One of America's most endearing and intriguing movie stars, he \.(n)

programme.title: Jesus the Game Changer
programme.desc: The sequel to the award-winning documentary Jesus the Game Changer is a 13 episode series, hosted by Karl Faase. Why did followers of Jesus take this message and risk danger and death to ensure people heard the Gospel? Follow along as Karl speaks to over 50 guests around the world about how and why the gospel spread to become a truly global faith. Be inspired by stories of faith and courage of those who went to the ends of the earth, and consider what it looks like now to take the gospel from everywhere, to everywhere.(n)

programme.title: Capt'n Chuckleberry
programme.sub-title: E36 Fun Times with Captain Chuckleberry
programme.desc: Capt'n Chuckleberry, First Mate Kate and their feathery friend Roscoe the Bird find fun ways to teach kids normal life skills and the love of God, aboard the animated vessel - Tugboat Bob. In every journey we visit animated friends, Teenkle the worm, Larry the Light Bouy, Benny the bottle nose and Dolly the dolphin. Lil' Sailors all over the world will love Capt'n Chuckleberry.(n)

programme.title: OK TV
programme.desc: Powerful, life filled topics are presented in an enjoyable and proven format. Hosts, Brendon and Cathie have poured their 30 years of experience with kids in schools and in ministry and the great goals of the local church into a energetic show that will engage the next generation.(n)

programme.title: Whirl
programme.desc: Whirl is a Bible-based cartoon series about the loveable, sometimes overly-enthusiastic kids of First Second Church. In each episode, the kids tackle a different theme that is central to Christian values. Everything from generosity and forgiveness to doubt and the trinity are explored over the course of the series. And while the issues dealt with in each episode are relatable, the solutions this kooky cast often find are a bit... unconventional. Whether the kids of First Second Church are searching for a hidden sanctum of the church's altar guild, or trying to outsmart robots bent on world domination, these characters will keep the whole family laughing and learning.(n)

programme.title: A Very Tall Man
programme.desc: Gary Hoogvliet, a very tall man, interviews interesting folk, not quite as tall as he, but nevertheless with fascinating and inspiring stories to tell.(n)

programme.title: Bringing Up Bates
programme.sub-title: E13 A Big Bates Thanksgiving Pt2
programme.desc: Get ready to give thanks, Bates style. The whole family heads to Gil's parents' farm for a super-sized family dinner. The family joins hands to say what they're thankful for. Someone reveals a surprise.(n)

programme.title: Joan of Arcadia
programme.desc: Millions of people speak to God. What if God spoke back? No one would ever believe Joan Girardi if she told them that God is talking to her. Does Joan have a higher purpose on earth, or are these strange conversations just in her head?(n)

programme.title: To The Ends
programme.desc: What was birthed as a dream in 2009 to bring surfboards and skateboards to children living in poverty around the world quickly grew into a vision far greater; the hope of impacting the world through action sports. Over the last 10 years, Ride Nature has led over 70 international trips, visited 27 different countries, hosted countless events, and given away over 2,000 boards to children living in poverty all around the world. This 10 part film series shares the story of Ride Nature and the lives impacted along the way.(n)

programme.title: Catching Hearts
programme.desc: Professor Mark Gavin is a bestselling author and speaker who makes his living by disproving the existence of God. But what happens when extraordinary and unexplainable life events shake his faith in atheism? Will he turn his back on the very ideas that made him rich and famous? This provocative drama follows the intertwined stories of Gavin and two of his biggest fans, an aimless young man who can't see beyond the next party and a young woman who can't face her guilt after a tragic mistake. Each takes comfort in Gavin's assertion that life is a series of random and meaningless events. But when 'coincidence' brings all three together, they must face the evidence before their eyes.(n)

programme.title: New Horizons
programme.sub-title: E67 Set Free to Follow God Pt15
programme.desc: The stories told in the book of Exodus are among the most foundational in the whole of the Bible. God's rescue of his people from slavery is a model for every act of salvation and these events are continually reinterpreted to make sense of God's actions. However, God's interest is not merely in rescuing an oppressed group of people, but to bring them into a life-giving relationship that is part of his biggest plan to renew the whole world.(n)

programme.title: New Creation Church
programme.sub-title: E66 Speak God's Language of Faith Pt2
programme.desc: Pastor Joseph Prince preaches dynamic messages centred on the pure gospel of the grace of God. His desire is to help believers understand grace and how greatly blessed they are by their heavenly Father.(n)

programme.title: The Leon Show
programme.desc: Leon Fontaine hosts this Spirit Contemporary daily talk show that explores relevant topics with world-renowned guests such as Franklin Graham, Roma Downey, Max Lucado, Lee Strobel, Darlene Zschech and many more. The Leon Show is produced at Miracle Channel studios in Canada and has broad distribution around the world.(n)

programme.title: Elevation Experience
programme.desc: The Elevation Experience with Pastor Steven Furtick features inspirational messages from Pastor Steven as well as original worship music from Elevation Church in Charlotte, North Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered
programme.desc: A group of postal detectives work to solve the mysteries behind undeliverable letters and packages from the past, delivering them when they are needed most. On the same day Oliver's estranged wife Holly reappears, the postal detectives deliver divorce papers to another couple grappling with the true meaning of love and marriage.(n)

programme.title: Billy Graham Classics
programme.sub-title: E90 What You Cannot Do Without
programme.desc: The best-known Christian evangelist of the 20th century, Billy Graham gained world attention in 1949 with a tent revival in downtown Los Angeles that was scheduled for three weeks and lasted six. In the ensuing 55 years and more, 'Billy Graham Crusades' consistently drew audiences of thousands to arenas and stadiums throughout the world.'Classic Crusades' presents the best of the last 35 years of Billy Graham that brought the message of salvation through Jesus Christ to the world. World renowned actors, singers, athletes and ministers share the platform with Dr. Graham. Also often features the famous sounds of the Billy Graham Choir, George Beverly Shea and Cliff Barrows for an hour of blessing and inspiration to all who watch.(n)

programme.title: GGC Life TV
programme.desc: Glorious Gospel Church has been meeting the needs of the community since 1990. With a vision for a church that is REAL, RELATABLE, ENJOYABLE, LIFE-CHANGING & UPLIFTING, they are committed to providing church services that will enable you to experience church this way. Linked by mutual vision and values, which are based firmly in the Bible and what the Bible teaches, GGC's mandate is to express the Good News of Jesus Christ in a relatable and practical way..(n)

programme.desc: The RocKids TV universe is centred around an imaginary TV network that airs fun and fantastic shows that teach kids about Jesus and the Bible.(n)

programme.title: A Life of Victory
programme.desc: Former tennis great Margaret Court is now as passionate about God and His love for people as she was about winning tennis. 'A Life of Victory with Margaret Court' includes empowering teaching, and uplifting contenporary Gospel music performed by the Victory Life worship team.(n)

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of FBI agent Sue Thomas in Washington DC. She's one hard-headed, soft-hearted woman whose talent for reading lips helps crack crimes and bag the bad guys in places listening devices can't penetrate. With her hearing-ear dog, Levi, Sue's a glutton for jeopardy - and there's (almost) nothing she won't do to bring notorious criminals to justice. This remarkable, edge-of-your-seat drama is an inspiring tribute to the ability of the human spirit to overcome adversity and achieve great things. Inspired by a true story.(n)

programme.title: When Calls the Heart
programme.sub-title: E05 Home is Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: When Calls the Heart follows the adventures of Elizabeth Thatcher, a young teacher accustomed to her high-society life. She receives her first classroom assignment in Hope Valley, a small town in Western Canada. There, life is simple - but often fraught with challenges. Elizabeth charms most everyone in Hope Valley, especially young mountie Jack Thornton. Elizabeth must learn the ways of the Canadian frontier if she wishes to thrive in the rural west on her own but she soon learns that friendship and community are the source of love and life.(n)

programme.title: Bringing Up Bates
programme.sub-title: E32 The Quest for the Dress
programme.desc: Michaella takes Kelly Jo and her sisters into town to look for a wedding dress. But after hours and hours of searching, she gives up. None of the dresses are right. The wedding is only 2 months away and Michael is starting to get nervous!(n)

programme.title: Answers with Bayless Conley
programme.sub-title: E12 5 Ways to be in the Will of God Pt2
programme.desc: Bayless Conley is a church leader and speaker, known for both his clear presentation of the Bible message and the way he applies it to everyday life. Bayless grew up in Southern California where, during his teenage years, he became involved in a lifestyle of drug and alcohol abuse. After years of searching for truth, and a number of near-death experiences, he found answers and freedom in Jesus when a 12-year-old boy shared God's message of hope with him in a park one day. Bayless' unique background and remarkable story have enabled him to reach a diverse audience globally. Today, the Answers with Bayless Conley broadcast is impacting lives around the world in numerous languages. Bayless is the founding and senior pastor of Cottonwood Church in Orange County, California. He and his wife, Janet, are the parents of three grown children, and enthusiastic grandparents. Together they passionately pursue life, God, and family. In Answers with Bayless Conley, Bayless offers clear and practical Bible teaching that helps viewers find answers for their life. His passion is to see the truth of God's Word set people free.(n)

programme.title: The Blessed Life with Robert Morris
programme.desc: Gateway Church is a multicampus, nondenominational church in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex led by Pastor Robert Morris. Since it began in 2000, the church has grown to more than 39,000 active members and six local campuses. Its vision is to see people saved, healed, set free, discipled, equipped, empowered, and serving. Its mission is to help each person at Gateway believe in Jesus, belong to family, become a follower, and build God's kingdom.(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: The 700 Club is a daily magazine programme with news, interviews, lifestyle features and true-life stories from a Christian perspective. including powerful and dramatic testimonies of God touching people's lives. Where does the name The 700 Club come from? When the show started to air more than 50 years ago, founder and host Pat Robertson needed to have just 700 Partners to donate $5 a month to make the programme possible. Those original 700 supporters couldn't have imagined they would start a TV show that is now seen every day in over 200 countries, impacting the nations with the Gospel of Jesus Christ!(n)

programme.title: Joyce Meyer Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.sub-title: E60 The Armour of Righteousness - Part 1

programme.title: In Touch
programme.sub-title: E12 Seeking Godly Counsel - Being An Encourager
programme.desc: The In Touch program reaches the world with the Gospel with messages that tackle such issues as parenting, finances, personal crises, emotions, and relationships. Dr. Stanley fervently believes the Bible to be the inerrant Word of God, a belief strongly reflected in his teaching. Dr Charles Stanley is the author of more than 50 books.(n)

programme.title: Bible Man
programme.sub-title: E12 Say Goodbye to the Grand Duchess of Greed Part 1
programme.desc: Miles Peterson had everything: Money, power, fame...Until he lost it. Then Miles finds the power of God and harnesses that power to become Bibleman.(n)

programme.title: Adventures Sea Kids
programme.desc: Freddy, David, Melissa and their friends find themselves navigating the rough waters of peer pressure, temptation, fear, forgiving others, listening to parents, dealing with bullies, lack of self-esteem, and so much more. Children can relate to these adorable characters and their problematic situations. Each action-packed, beautifully animated episode, shows the characters praying to Jesus, asking Him for guidance and wisdom. The Sea Kids will help transform the heart and mind of every child as they learn how to tangibly live out the biblical principles being taught while building a strong foundation in Jesus.(n)

programme.title: Torchlighters: Heroes of the Faith
programme.desc: The fiery monk whose 95 Theses sparked the Reformation. In a world ruled by the church, all it took was one little nail, one well-written scroll, and one sharp-tongued monk to turn everything upside-down! Martin Luther didn't mean to spark the Reformation with his 95 Theses, but his realisation that salvation comes through faith and not works ignited the revolution that changed the world.(n)

programme.title: Holy Moly
programme.desc: Holy Moly turns the Bible into a living, breathing colouring book that will delight children of all ages. Eyes will be fixed on the screen, observing how God is at work in the story when colour is introduced to an otherwise black-and-white world. Rather than dialogue, the series focuses on the Biblical characters' actions and emotions to help audiences of any language or background immediately relate to and remember these enriching stories.(n)

programme.title: Be That
programme.desc: In this episode, the Be That crew are hoping to shed some light on an issue that affects everyone in some way or at some point in their lives - mental health. Society has come a long way in normalising and embracing it as a genuine health issue but there still exists a stigma when it comes to culture's attitudes toward who it's supposed to affect and how to deal with it. This week's topic is Healthy Emotions, and in the studio are two amazing Aussie men who've had very different experiences with mental health, but shared similar journeys in having found the courage to reach out and talk about their emotions.(n)

programme.title: A Very Tall Man
programme.desc: Gary Hoogvliet, a very tall man, interviews interesting folk, not quite as tall as he, but nevertheless with fascinating and inspiring stories to tell.(n)

programme.title: Billy Graham: An Extraordinary Journey
programme.desc: Explore key moments in Billy Graham's journey as a dairy farmer's son who rose to prominence, becoming one of the most influential religious leaders in modern history.(n)

programme.title: Planetshakers TV
programme.desc: Planetshakers' mission is to 'empower a generation to win a generation'. This Christian youth movement began as an annual conference in Melbourne that saw thousands of people of different ages, backgrounds and nationalities from all over the globe gather together. The movement grew and grew into an international ministry and church. Russell and Sam Evans are the senior pastors of Planetshakers City Church and Planetshakers TV showcases weekly teaching and music.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Journey Presents
programme.sub-title: E78 Lincoln: A Greater Good For All Mankind
programme.desc: The Incredible Journey is passionate about sharing the good news of Christ and preparing people for the soon coming of Jesus, offering Biblical answers to life's questions. Pastor Gary Kent is an archaeologist who has excavated numerous sites throughout Israel and Jordan. As an internationally-acclaimed speaker and TV presenter, he has spoken and produced numerous documentaries on subjects including the Bible, Bible prophecy, world events and natural health. His passion is to share the good news of Jesus' imminent return.(n)

programme.title: The Way of the Master
programme.desc: The Way of the Master television program, airing in over 190 countries, offers a unique and fascinating twist on reality TV. Each half-hour program teaches Christians how to share their faith effectively and inoffensively and then demonstrates it through real-life witnessing encounters. See Ray Comfort and his team follow Jesus' example by going to the highways and byways, malls and movie theatres, college campuses and local coffeehouses, to share the gospel with people from all walks of life: teenagers, intellectuals, atheists, Muslims, Jews, cult members, backsliders, and the self-righteous. Each episode also provides practical biblical instruction as the team tackles the most common questions and objections of the Christian faith and addresses challenging arguments and difficult situations. In this entertaining and equipping show, not only will you learn how to speak with your unsaved family and friends, but you will be given powerful tools that will replace your fears with courage.(n)

programme.title: PowerPoint with Dr. Jack Graham
programme.desc: PowerPoint Ministries started as a vision of Dr Jack Graham and his wife, Deb, 20 years ago. They believed that the power of God was evident in their growing church and that His Gospel message should be spread beyond the walls of that church to the world at large. They put their faith into action and purchased airtime on the Trinity Broadcasting Network. PowerPoint Ministries was then officially launched in April 1994. Over the past 19 years, PowerPoint Ministries has grown to an expansive network of local, national, and international television and radio broadcasts. In fact, PowerPoint can be seen or heard by a potential audience of millions of television viewers and radio listeners across the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, South Africa, Iran, Russia, Israel and more. The Ministry has a vision to glorify God by introducing Jesus Christ as Lord to as many people as possible and to develop them in Christian living using the most effective means to impact the world, making an eternal difference in this generation.(n)

programme.title: David Pawson
programme.sub-title: E415 Building a New Testament Church Pt2b
programme.desc: Why was the Bible written? David Pawson explores scripture and discovers some hidden gems. David Pawson has a BSc in Agriculture and an MA in Theology from Cambridge. He was a Chaplain in the RAF for three years and went on to become Pastor of two Baptist Churches (Gold Hill in Buckinghamshire and the Millmead Centre in Guildford) where he maintained a strong Bible teaching ministry. Released for a wider ministry in 1979, he has since spoken in numerous towns and cities in the British Isles and also extensively overseas. He is the author of a number of books including Truth To Tell, Leadership is Male and The Normal Christian Birth.(n)

programme.title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered

programme.title: Bringing Up Bates
programme.desc: When you have 19 kids, it's hard to spend one-on-one time with any of them. But it's not impossible. Kelly makes a point to spend the day with Trace, while Gil and Josie take off for a father/daughter adventure. Afterward, the whole family gathers together as Addee and Ellie celebrate their birthdays with a joint swim party!(n)

programme.title: Jentezen Franklin
programme.desc: New York Times bestselling author, Pastor Jentezen Franklin, brings practical meaning to spiritual truths found in God's Word. Kingdom Connection is the teaching ministry of Free Chapel, a multi-campus church with a global ministry. Hear inspiration for change, healing, peace and joy through his affective communication connecting you to God, the church, and the world!(n)

programme.title: PowerPoint with Dr. Jack Graham
programme.desc: PowerPoint Ministries started as a vision of Dr Jack Graham and his wife, Deb, 20 years ago. They believed that the power of God was evident in their growing church and that His Gospel message should be spread beyond the walls of that church to the world at large. They put their faith into action and purchased airtime on the Trinity Broadcasting Network. PowerPoint Ministries was then officially launched in April 1994. Over the past 19 years, PowerPoint Ministries has grown to an expansive network of local, national, and international television and radio broadcasts. In fact, PowerPoint can be seen or heard by a potential audience of millions of television viewers and radio listeners across the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, South Africa, Iran, Russia, Israel and more. The Ministry has a vision to glorify God by introducing Jesus Christ as Lord to as many people as possible and to develop them in Christian living using the most effective means to impact the world, making an eternal difference in this generation.(n)

programme.title: Joyce Meyer Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.sub-title: E61 The Armor of Righteousness Pt2
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the world's leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.(n)

programme.title: Hour of Power
programme.desc: Since 1970 the Hour of Power has been reaching viewers from around the world. Originally founded by Dr Robert H Schuller, the program became the most-watched religious program in the world, reaching 17 million viewers. Now under the leadership of Bobby Schuller, Dr Schuller's grandson. The congregation worships at Shepherd's Grove Church in Garden Grove, CA. The program aims to provide spiritual principles and practices that can help people, as they become happy students of Jesus and live a life of meaning. To learn more about who they are in Christ through the process of formation, to belong to his family of believers and become a part of the community and to heal as they are loved and then love and help heal others through mission. Jesus Christ ushered in the Kingdom of God into our world through His death and resurrection. He invites everyone to be a part of this amazing movement by trusting and following Him. There is no fuller, richer life than the one that is lived in Christ.(n)

programme.title: A Very Tall Man
programme.desc: Gary Hoogvliet, a very tall man, interviews interesting folk, not quite as tall as he, but nevertheless with fascinating and inspiring stories to tell.(n)

programme.title: Billy Graham: An Extraordinary Journey
programme.desc: Explore key moments in Billy Graham's journey as a dairy farmer's son who rose to prominence, becoming one of the most influential religious leaders in modern history.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Journey Presents
programme.sub-title: E78 Lincoln: A Greater Good For All Mankind
programme.desc: The Incredible Journey is passionate about sharing the good news of Christ and preparing people for the soon coming of Jesus, offering Biblical answers to life's questions. Pastor Gary Kent is an archaeologist who has excavated numerous sites throughout Israel and Jordan. As an internationally-acclaimed speaker and TV presenter, he has spoken and produced numerous documentaries on subjects including the Bible, Bible prophecy, world events and natural health. His passion is to share the good news of Jesus' imminent return.(n)

programme.title: Arnie's Shack
programme.sub-title: E16 Arnie's Shack in Fiji Ep2
programme.desc: Arnie and friends were blessed to be able to travel to Fiji, a beautiful country, with lovely friendly people. Come and see some amazing sights. From the highlands to the beach. Ranger Hardy discovers some interesting plants and animals, Postman PJ takes us on a tour of Fulton College, Shane learns how to make Roti and Arnie even gets to go into a Chief's house.(n)

programme.title: Hillsong Kids: A Big Life
programme.desc: Hillsong Kids \.(n)

programme.title: What's in the Bible?
programme.desc: What's in the Bible? How is it put together? What does it teach us? Join VeggieTales creator Phil Vischer and a bunch of hilarious new friends on a journey through the world's most important book, the Bible! This new series will have the whole family laughing and learning their way through God's Word.(n)

programme.title: Your Best Life with Phil Pringle
programme.desc: Your Best Life with Phil Pringle is an inspiring and uplifting Christian program, empowering you to live your best life for Jesus Christ. Featuring teaching with Pastor Phil Pringle, and passionate worship led by the C3 Church Australia music team. Your Best Life exists to bring the life-changing message of Jesus Christ into households across the globe, inspiring people to live for Jesus Christ, giving Him glory by living their best life.(n)

programme.title: TV4DADs
programme.desc: The team from TV4DADS returns with an all new man camp, this time in Michigan. This popular teaching program uncovers keys to successful parenting with special emphasis on the noble calling of Fatherhood. It captures the highs and lows of this diverse group of fathers, mentors and sons as they spend ten days together in Michigan at Man Camp. With music by Chris Molitor and special messages from Malachi ministry teachers, Brian Molitor, Brian Pruitt and Ron Ives, the Dads and sons spend time in prayer, participate in campfire discussions and enjoy a diverse range of activities such as archery, horse-riding, fishing, zip-lining and canoeing.(n)

programme.title: The National Bible Bee Gameshow
programme.desc: The National Bible Bee Game Show - hosted by Kirk Cameron - assembles 72 young people in a contest showcasing Bible-verse memory and applied Bible study. With $270,000 in prize money, the field of contestants comes from participants at the annual National Bible Bee.(n)

programme.title: When Calls the Heart
programme.desc: When Calls the Heart follows the adventures of a young teacher accustomed to her high-society life. She receives her first classroom assignment in Hope Valley, a small town in Western Canada. There, life is simple - but often fraught with challenges. Elizabeth must learn the ways of the rural west if she wishes to thrive on her own, but she soon learns that friendship and community are the source of love and life. In season 7 Elizabeth is enjoying being mother to a busy toddler and pursues a unique career opportunity. Lucas and Nathan let Elizabeth know how they feel about her, so will Elizabeth choose to pursue a romance with saloon owner Lucas or mountie Nathan this season? Meanwhile, Clara and Jesse plan their wedding, Lee reveals a big secret about his past to Rosemary, Nathan is confronted with his past when his father shows up in town, Bill has to put a jury together, Lucas and Gowen face problems with Gowen Petroleum, and Carson and Faith face some challenges in their relationship. Finally, our characters have to deal with more than just emotional slings and arrows as they tackle life in a pioneer town on the Canadian frontier.(n)

programme.title: Jesus the Game Changer
programme.desc: The sequel to the award-winning documentary Jesus the Game Changer is a 13 episode series, hosted by Karl Faase. Why did followers of Jesus take this message and risk danger and death to ensure people heard the Gospel? Follow along as Karl speaks to over 50 guests around the world about how and why the gospel spread to become a truly global faith. Be inspired by stories of faith and courage of those who went to the ends of the earth, and consider what it looks like now to take the gospel from everywhere, to everywhere.(n)

programme.title: One On One
programme.desc: One on One with Kirk Cameron, features Kirk and his inspiring friends meeting one-on-one, pushing their limits with some California fun - rock climbing, go-cart racing, navigating escape rooms, and more. Afterwards, they hang out, for an uncensored talk about faith, family, and what matters most.(n)

Since it began in 2000, the church has grown to more than 39,000 active members and six local campuses. Its vision is to see people saved, healed, set free, discipled, equipped, empowered, and serving. Its mission is to help each person at Gateway believe in Jesus, belong to family, become a follower, and build God's kingdom.(n)

Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Dokfilm -Birma Und Die Rohingya - Mord Nach Plan
programme.desc: Uber 700.000 Rohingya wurden aus Birma vertrieben und sind ins Nachbarland Bangladesch geflohen. Hunderte Doerfer wurden niedergebrannt, zahlreiche Vergewaltigungen und Massaker verubt. Der Film beleuchtet die Hintergrunde des Voelkermords.(n)

programme.title: Fokus Europa -Laender, Menschen, Schicksale
programme.desc: COVID-19 hat Italien fest im Griff. +++ Griechische Grenzschutzer gehen hart gegen Fluchtlinge vor.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Der Vulkan, Der Die Welt Veraenderte
programme.desc: Vor uber 200 Jahren bricht in Indonesien der Vulkan Tambora aus: Tausende Menschen sterben. Durch die Aschewolke kommt es auf der ganzen Nordhalbkugel zu Missernten, Epidemien und Burgeraufstaenden. Der Film zeigt das Ausmass der Katastrophe.(n)

programme.title: Reporter -'Ocean Viking' - Lebensretter Auf See
programme.desc: Einsatzleiter Nick und seine rechte Hand Tanguy im Dauereinsatz: Bei drei Rettungsaktionen im Mittelmeer nehmen sie 276 Gefluchtete an Bord ihres Rettungsschiffs 'Ocean Viking'. Traumatisierte Menschen, die mit dem Leben schon abgeschlossen hatten.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Nahaufnahme -China: Tagebuch In Quarantaene
programme.desc: China kaempft gegen das Coronavirus nach dem Motto: 'Quarantaene, 2.0'. Der Journalist Sebastien Le Belzic, der in Peking arbeitet, lebt in diesen Tagen mit seiner Familie eingesperrt zu Hause.(n)

programme.title: Fokus Europa -Laender, Menschen, Schicksale
programme.desc: COVID-19 hat Italien fest im Griff. +++ Griechische Grenzschutzer gehen hart gegen Fluchtlinge vor.(n)

programme.title: Expedition In Die Heimat -Unterwegs Im Kannenbaeckerland
programme.desc: Hier macht der Ton die Musik! Allerdings nicht der furs Ohr, sondern der, woraus Kruge oder Kannen gebrannt werden. Ein spannender Streifzug durch eines der bedeutendsten Tonabbaugebiete Europas. Wer kennt sie nicht, diese grau-blauen Kruge und Kannen aus dem Westerwald? Die wurden hier millionenfach 'gebacken'. Kannenbaeckerland heisst deshalb diese Kulturlandschaft.(n)

programme.title: Frag Den Lesch -Fusionsenergie - Das Ewige Versprechen
programme.desc: 'Die Sonne auf die Erde holen', das ist der Traum vieler Forscher. Koennte man aus Kernfusion nach dem Vorbild der Sonne Energie gewinnen? Dann waere die Frage nach der Energiequelle der Zukunft fur sehr, sehr lange Zeit beantwortet. Doch seit Jahrzehnten hofft man auf das Gelingen - auch jetzt ist das Ziel noch nicht in Sicht.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Der Vulkan, Der Die Welt Veraenderte
programme.desc: Vor uber 200 Jahren bricht in Indonesien der Vulkan Tambora aus: Tausende Menschen sterben. Durch die Aschewolke kommt es auf der ganzen Nordhalbkugel zu Missernten, Epidemien und Burgeraufstaenden. Der Film zeigt das Ausmass der Katastrophe.(n)

programme.title: Quarks -Verborgene Bodenschaetze In Nrw - Was Schlummert Unter Unseren Fussen?
programme.desc: Bodenschaetze koennen ein Land reich machen. So war es dank Stein- und Braunkohle auch in NRW. Aber was bleibt nach dem Ende der Kohle in NRW? Welche Bodenschaetze praegen die Menschen entlang des Rheins und der Ruhr? Moderator Ralph Caspers reist durch das Land und entdeckt NRWs Bodenschaetze neu: von Salz uber Sand bis Grubenwasser.(n)

programme.title: Shift -Leben In Der Digitalen Welt
programme.desc: SHIFT-Moderator Roger Ditter hat den Robotik-Experten Hiroshi Ishiguro in seinem Labor in Kyoto besucht. Japan ist fuhrend in der Erforschung autonomer Roboter. SHIFT zeigt, wozu die Androiden bereits in der Lage sind.(n)

programme.title: Fokus Europa -Laender, Menschen, Schicksale
programme.desc: COVID-19 hat Italien fest im Griff. +++ Griechische Grenzschutzer gehen hart gegen Fluchtlinge vor.(n)

programme.title: Frag Den Lesch -Machen Reisen Zum Mars Dement?
programme.desc: Immer wieder erreichen Harald Lesch Fragen von Zuschauern nach Leben auf dem Mars. Wie steht es mit Wasser? Wie mit Temperaturen und einer Atmosphaere, die Leben moeglich machen? Die NASA will in den kommenden Jahrzehnten die ersten Menschen auf eine Reise zum Mars schicken. Doch ist das wirklich ratsam?(n)

programme.title: Made In Germany -Infizierte Globalisierung - Das Virus Und Unsere Weltwirtschaft
programme.desc: Nicht nur die Erkrankung wird zum globalen Notfall. Inzwischen braucht die Wirtschaft eine Impfung gegen die Panik-Pandemie. Untergangspropheten befeuern die Crash-Angst, Kritiker fordern: Deglobalisiert euch! Doch Panik hilft nicht weiter.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Der Zweite Weltkrieg - Endzeit
programme.desc: Fruhjahr 1945, die Endphase des Zweiten Weltkrieges. Um den irrsinnigen Traum vom Endsieg weiter zu verfolgen, schicken die Nazis skrupellos immer jungere Jahrgaenge an die Front. Dabei ist das Kriegsende schon in Sicht.(n)

programme.title: Fit Und Gesund -Schmerzmittel
programme.desc: Gegen Schmerzen gibt es eine Vielzahl von Medikamenten. Aber was ist mit deren Nebenwirkungen? Und wann kann Physiotherapie weiterhelfen? Wir sprechen mit dem Schmerzmediziner Dr. Michael Schenk. Ausserdem: Mythos Aspirin und Cannabidiole.(n)

programme.desc: Hier macht der Ton die Musik! Allerdings nicht der furs Ohr, sondern der, woraus Kruge oder Kannen gebrannt werden. Ein spannender Streifzug durch eines der bedeutendsten Tonabbaugebiete Europas. Wer kennt sie nicht, diese grau-blauen Kruge und Kannen aus dem Westerwald? Die wurden hier millionenfach 'gebacken'. Kannenbaeckerland heisst deshalb diese Kulturlandschaft.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Fokus Europa -Laender, Menschen, Schicksale
programme.desc: COVID-19 hat Italien fest im Griff. +++ Griechische Grenzschutzer gehen hart gegen Fluchtlinge vor.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Der 'Tyrannosaurus' Von Tambach-Dietharz
programme.desc: Nirgendwo auf der Welt wurden so viele gut erhaltene Saurier-Fossilien aufgespurt wie in Thuringen. Fast jeder Skelettfund avancierte zu einer Weltsensation. Und die Archaeologen graben weiter. Eine neue Art koennten sie bereits entdeckt haben.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Dokfilm -Der Zweite Weltkrieg - Endzeit
programme.desc: Fruhjahr 1945, die Endphase des Zweiten Weltkrieges. Um den irrsinnigen Traum vom Endsieg weiter zu verfolgen, schicken die Nazis skrupellos immer jungere Jahrgaenge an die Front. Dabei ist das Kriegsende schon in Sicht.(n)

programme.title: Check-In -Leipzig - Stadt Im Wandel
programme.desc: Jung, dynamisch, kreativ - Leipzig ist eine aufstrebende deutsche Metropole. 1989 begann hier die Friedliche Revolution. Lukas Stege unternimmt einen Ausflug in Vergangenheit und Gegenwart der Stadt.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Birma Und Die Rohingya - Mord Nach Plan
programme.desc: Uber 700.000 Rohingya wurden aus Birma vertrieben und sind ins Nachbarland Bangladesch geflohen. Hunderte Doerfer wurden niedergebrannt, zahlreiche Vergewaltigungen und Massaker verubt. Der Film beleuchtet die Hintergrunde des Voelkermords.(n)

programme.title: Auf Den Punkt -Der Internationale Talk Aus Berlin
Frag Den Lesch -Fusionsenergie - Das Ewige Versprechen
programme.desc: 'Die Sonne auf die Erde holen', das ist der Traum vieler Forscher. Koennte man aus Kernfusion nach dem Vorbild der Sonne Energie gewinnen? Dann waere die Frage nach der Energiequelle der Zukunft fur sehr, sehr lange Zeit beantwortet. Doch seit Jahrzehnten hofft man auf das Gelingen - auch jetzt ist das Ziel noch nicht in Sicht.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Dokfilm -Der Vulkan, Der Die Welt Veraenderte
programme.desc: Vor uber 200 Jahren bricht in Indonesien der Vulkan Tambora aus: Tausende Menschen sterben. Durch die Aschewolke kommt es auf der ganzen Nordhalbkugel zu Missernten, Epidemien und Burgeraufstaenden. Der Film zeigt das Ausmass der Katastrophe.(n)

programme.title: Fit Und Gesund -Schmerzmittel
programme.desc: Gegen Schmerzen gibt es eine Vielzahl von Medikamenten. Aber was ist mit deren Nebenwirkungen? Und wann kann Physiotherapie weiterhelfen? Wir sprechen mit dem Schmerzmediziner Dr. Michael Schenk. Ausserdem: Mythos Aspirin und Cannabidiole.(n)

programme.title: Auf Den Punkt -Der Internationale Talk Aus Berlin
Frag Den Lesch -Machen Reisen Zum Mars Dement?
programme.desc: Immer wieder erreichen Harald Lesch Fragen von Zuschauern nach Leben auf dem Mars. Wie steht es mit Wasser? Wie mit Temperaturen und einer Atmosphaere, die Leben moeglich machen? Die NASA will in den kommenden Jahrzehnten die ersten Menschen auf eine Reise zum Mars schicken. Doch ist das wirklich ratsam?(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Birma Und Die Rohingya - Mord Nach Plan
programme.desc: Uber 700.000 Rohingya wurden aus Birma vertrieben und sind ins Nachbarland Bangladesch geflohen. Hunderte Doerfer wurden niedergebrannt, zahlreiche Vergewaltigungen und Massaker verubt. Der Film beleuchtet die Hintergrunde des Voelkermords.(n)

programme.title: Zu Tisch... -In Slawonien
programme.desc: Im aeussersten Osten Kroatiens liegt Slawonien, eine von Flussauen und Ackerflaechen gepraegte Landschaft. Dieses fruchtbare Gebiet in der Pannonischen Tiefebene gilt als Kornkammer des Landes. Im Dorf Bilje, unweit der Mundung der Drau in die Donau, lebt die Familie Lackovic. Sie vermehrt alte Tomaten- und Paprikasorten und kocht nur das, was sie auch in ihrem Garten anbaut.(n)

programme.title: Gespraech -Lehrer Am Limit
programme.desc: Ulrich Timm im Gespraech mit Julia Woellenstein, Gesamtschullehrerin und Autorin.(n)

programme.title: Projekt Zukunft -Von Mull Bis Mangroven
programme.desc: In Zukunft koennten Wind- und Sonnenenergie in einem ungewoehnlichen Turm gespeichert werden. Ausserdem: In Brasilia wird ein neues Abfallmanagement installiert. Stecken im Mangrovensumpf antibiotische Wirkstoffe? Und warum ist Pluto kein Planet mehr?(n)

programme.title: 37 Grad -Notfall Hausarzt - Praxensterben In Deutschland
programme.desc: Der klassische Hausarzt wird zum Auslaufmodell. Schon heute stehen in Deutschland Tausende Praxen leer. '37 Grad' begleitet verzweifelte Patienten, uberlastete AErzte und ratlose Behoerden.(n)

programme.title: Europe In Concert -Simple Minds (Grossbritannien)
programme.desc: Die Simple Minds grunden sich 1978 in Glasgow. Den Namen entlehnen sie einer Textzeile des David Bowie-Songs 'The Jean Genie'. Von der Urbesetzung sind heute noch Saenger Jim Kerr und Gitarrist Charlie Burchill dabei. Im Laufe ihrer Karriere haben sie rund 60 Millionen Tontraeger verkauft.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Quarks -Verborgene Bodenschaetze In Nrw - Was Schlummert Unter Unseren Fussen?
programme.desc: Bodenschaetze koennen ein Land reich machen. So war es dank Stein- und Braunkohle auch in NRW. Aber was bleibt nach dem Ende der Kohle in NRW? Welche Bodenschaetze praegen die Menschen entlang des Rheins und der Ruhr? Moderator Ralph Caspers reist durch das Land und entdeckt NRWs Bodenschaetze neu: von Salz uber Sand bis Grubenwasser.(n)

programme.title: Pur+ -Eric Wird 80
programme.desc: Muhsam die Treppe zur U-Bahn hinauf, ein Blick auf das Handy-Display: unscharfe Buchstaben! Wie fuhlt es sich an alt zu sein? Eric macht den Selbstversuch im Altersanzug. Die 6-jaehrige Yelda hatte keine Grosseltern mehr. Jutta war 63 und wurde ihre Ersatz-Oma. Sie gingen zusammen ins Kino und schwimmen. Yelda ist jetzt 13 und besucht Jutta weiter jede Woche. Was macht ihre Freundschaft aus?(n)

programme.title: Shift -Leben In Der Digitalen Welt
programme.desc: SHIFT-Moderator Roger Ditter hat den Robotik-Experten Hiroshi Ishiguro in seinem Labor in Kyoto besucht. Japan ist fuhrend in der Erforschung autonomer Roboter. SHIFT zeigt, wozu die Androiden bereits in der Lage sind.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Wenn Der Regen Nicht Mehr Faellt
programme.desc: Wasser und Regen werden knapp auf der Erde, eine Gefahr fur Mensch und Natur. Der Klimawandel veraendert den Kreislauf der Niederschlaege. Grundwasser wird knapp. Wenn die Menschheit nicht umdenkt, koennte der Wassermangel ihr Aus bedeuten.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Big Manni - Big Money: Die Wahre Geschichte Eines Milliardenbetrugs
programme.desc: Manfred Schmider hat mit seiner Firma FlowTex uber vier Milliarden Mark ergaunert. Einer der groessten Faelle von Wirtschaftskriminalitaet in Deutschland. Ruckblickend wundert er sich selbst, wie leicht es war, ein pompoeses Lugengebaeude zu errichten.(n)

programme.title: Verruckt Nach Meer -Die Drachen Von Singapur
programme.desc: In Singapur ubernimmt Kapitaen Morten Hansen das Kommando auf der 'Weissen Lady'. Auf den Reisebeginn prostet er seinem zweiten Offizier Christian Baumann mit dem klarsten Wasser der Stadt zu. Saengerin und Entertainerin Gloria Gray wandelt nicht nur durch die Gassen von Chinatown, sondern auch auf der hoechsten Joggingstrecke der Welt.(n)

programme.title: Frag Den Lesch -Energie Der Zukunft: Alternative Techniken
programme.desc: Ist Wasserstoff eine Energiequelle der Zukunft? Welche Herausforderungen sind zu meistern, wenn man Wasserstoffautos zur Grundlage unserer Mobilitaet der Zukunft machen will? Harald Lesch geht der Frage von Grund auf nach, vom Wasserstoffatom bis zur Brennstoffzelle, vom einzelnen Wasserstoffauto bis zur Infrastruktur des Verkehrssystems.(n)

programme.desc: Fast 7 Millionen Sklaven mussten im 17. Jahrhundert fur Zucker schuften. Franzosen, Englaender, Hollaender und Spanier - alle wollten vom Zuckerrohranbau profitieren. Teil 3 der 4-teiligen Dokuserie beleuchtet die Brutalitaet der Kolonialmaechte.(n)

programme.desc: Die Musik-Talkshow aus dem Haus Schminke im saechsischen Loebau mit einer Weltpremiere: Ein exklusives Duett von Anastacia und Conchita! Moderiert wird die Sendung von Kim Fisher und Wigald Boning.(n)

programme.title: Shift -Leben In Der Digitalen Welt
programme.desc: SHIFT-Moderator Roger Ditter hat den Robotik-Experten Hiroshi Ishiguro in seinem Labor in Kyoto besucht. Japan ist fuhrend in der Erforschung autonomer Roboter. SHIFT zeigt, wozu die Androiden bereits in der Lage sind.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Wenn Der Regen Nicht Mehr Faellt
programme.desc: Wasser und Regen werden knapp auf der Erde, eine Gefahr fur Mensch und Natur. Der Klimawandel veraendert den Kreislauf der Niederschlaege. Grundwasser wird knapp. Wenn die Menschheit nicht umdenkt, koennte der Wassermangel ihr Aus bedeuten.(n)

programme.title: Bares Fur Rares -Lieblingsstucke
programme.desc: Horst Lichter und seine drei Experten praesentieren und kommentieren ihre 'Lieblingsstucke' aus den vergangenen Sendungen. Ob antikes Rollsiegel oder skurriler Sperrmullfund: Die drei Experten von 'Bares fur Rares' bewerten alle Objekte mit Sachverstand und Liebe zum Detail. Die schoensten und skurrilsten Exponate stellen die drei jetzt noch einmal vor.(n)

programme.title: Expedition In Die Heimat -Vom Neckar An Die Murr
programme.desc: Moderatorin Annette Krause reist von Marbach am Neckar nach Backnang an der Murr. In der Schillerstadt Marbach hat der grosse Dichter Friedrich Schiller unubersehbare Spuren hinterlassen. Der grosse Astronom Tobias Mayer stammt ebenfalls aus Marbach.(n)

programme.title: Verruckt Nach Meer -Die Drachen Von Singapur
programme.desc: In Singapur ubernimmt Kapitaen Morten Hansen das Kommando auf der 'Weissen Lady'. Auf den Reisebeginn prostet er seinem zweiten Offizier Christian Baumann mit dem klarsten Wasser der Stadt zu. Saengerin und Entertainerin Gloria Gray wandelt nicht nur durch die Gassen von Chinatown, sondern auch auf der hoechsten Joggingstrecke der Welt.(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -Menschenhandel - Eine Kurze Geschichte Der Sklaverei: 1620 - 1789: Der Zuck
programme.desc: Fast 7 Millionen Sklaven mussten im 17. Jahrhundert fur Zucker schuften. Franzosen, Englaender, Hollaender und Spanier - alle wollten vom Zuckerrohranbau profitieren. Teil 3 der 4-teiligen Dokuserie beleuchtet die Brutalitaet der Kolonialmaechte.(n)

programme.title: Nahaufnahme -Die Aktuelle Reportage
programme.desc: Direkt, nah dran - jede Woche eine halbe Stunde Hintergrund zu aktuellen Themen aus Politik und Zeitgeschehen. Nicht nur zeigen, was geschieht, sondern wie und warum es geschieht. 'Nahaufnahme' - spannend, bildstark, informativ.(n)

programme.desc: Gletscherschmelze, Plastik im Meer, brennender Amazonas - die Nachrichten zu Klimawandel und Umweltzerstoerung sind verstoerend und oft widerspruchlich. Welche digitalen Mittel helfen im Kampf gegen den Klimawandel?(n)

programme.title: Dokfilm -US-Beutezug In Afrika - Operation Kony
programme.desc: Kann ein gefaelschtes Video einen Krieg in Afrika ausloesen? Der Film zeigt, wie ein angeblich humanitaeres Video und die Jagd auf den ugandischen Kriegsverbrecher Joseph Kony den USA als Vorwand fur militaerische Operationen in Afrika dienten.(n)

programme.title: Quarks -Sommer Oder Winterzeit - Warum Uns Zeitumstellungen So Stressen
programme.desc: Wer in Schichten arbeitet, wird eher ubergewichtig und ist anfaelliger fur manchen Krebs; nach der Umstellung auf die Sommerzeit erleiden Menschen haeufiger Herzinfarkte, und wenn Jugendliche zu fruh in die Schule mussen, werden die Noten schlechter. Nur drei Beispiele, die zeigen, was passieren kann, wenn der Mensch nicht in Einklang mit seinem naturlichen Rhythmus lebt.(n)

programme.title: Der Tag -Die Geschichten Hinter Den Nachrichten
Frautv -Frauenpolitisches Magazin
programme.desc: Unter anderem: Darum musste ich mich mal dringend kummern - denken viele Frauen, wenn sie feststellen, dass sie deutlich weniger verdienen als Maenner. Oder im Alter nur halb so viel Rente bekommen. Dabei koennten sie was aendern. Wenn sie sich um ihre Finanzen genauso kummern wurden, wie um ihre Familie oder ihren Job.(n)
